newsitem.title: UK: SmithKline Beecham profits surge, margins held.
newsitem.headline: SmithKline Beecham profits surge, margins held.

text.p: Anglo-American pharmaceuticals giant SmithKline Beecham Plc on Tuesday reported a 20 percent surge in third quarter pretax profits to 374 million stg, with sales rising 15 percent to two billion stg.

The third quarter dividend payout was 4.0 pence per share, payable on December 31. SmithKline said its operating margins in the three month period had been held despite a 25 percent hike in spending on research and development.
Jan Leschly, chief executive, said in a statement "We are particularly pleased with our overall performance which is driven by volume increases.

"In particular, excellent new product sales growth of 44 percent was a major contributor to the pharmaceutical sales increase of 18 percent," he said. The division's profits rose 20 percent during the period.
SmithKline cited in particular North American pharmaceutical sales growth of 33 percent.

Looking at some of the products in pharmaceuticals, the Seroxat/Paxil antidepressant saw sales up 54 percent to 189 million. The Relafen/Relifex sales were up 33 percent to 85 million. Kytril was up 33 percent also to 46 million.
In the consumer healthcare unit, sales rose 11 percent, with trading profit up five percent. Promotional expenses were reported to have hit margins.
Over the counter product sales rose nine percent. Oral care products rose 23 percent and nutritional healthcare sales rose seven percent.
In the clinical laboratories unit sales edged one percent ahead, with trading profit up 16 percent assisted by "vigorous implementation of cost management measures."
